data.title: Tracking Your Roots: Elmore County, Alabama Cemeteries Page
data.text:
Contributed by: Dot Tribble (MNTAssoc@aol.com).

The entire cemetery is comprised of two tombstones:

Mary Louise KERN, 18 Ma 1913-3 Feb 1981

George Luther CLARK, 1904-1956. (His wife, Clarene Kern, born 1908, is still alive. Mary Louise KERN was her sister.)

McKeithen Cemetery

Directions:

Take Hwy 14 from P'ville cross Elmore Co. line and go 2-3 miles. Left on Co Rd 7. Go 1/2 mile down Co Rd 7 and turn right on Canton Road--cemetery down this road on left abt 1/4 mile in the middle of a cow pasture. Its under a lone chinaberry growing in the pasture.

Contributed by: Dot Tribble (MNTAssoc@aol.com).

McKeithen Archibald Sr 3 Mar 1847 native of Bladen County NC. Died 75th year of his age

McKeithen Archibald Jr 2 Sep 1815 1 Oct 1831 youngest child of Arch'd & Mary McKeithen. Age 16 years 29 days

McKeithen Daniel 27 Oct 1857 born in N.C. Died Jefferson TX. Age 50 years, 8 months, 1 day

McKeithen Duncan 2 May 1809 8 Aug 1871 born in N.C. Died age 65 years, 3 months, 6 days

McKeithen Mary 14 Jan 1850 relict of Archibald McKeithen, Sr. Died 75 years, 3 months and 1 day

Note: This small cemetery lies north of Canton Road in a cow pasture. It is reached approximately 1/4 mile before the other McKeithen cemetery

Bibb Cemetery

Contributed by: Dot Tribble

This cemetery bears the distinction of having the 1st govenor of the Territories buried there (William Wyatt Bibb).

Bibb Mary Ann 9 Mar 1788 29 Apr 1856 widow of Gov. Wm W. Bibb

Bibb William Wyatt Gov 10 Jul 1820 in his 40th year. 1st Gov of the Territory and Gov of Alabama. Oldest son of William & Sally S. Bibb. Born in Prince Edward Co, VA

Freeman Pennin 17 Aug 1823 age 51 years. Born in N.C. Married Homan Freeman. Respects paid by her oldest son, Fleming Freeman

Hitchcock Caroline 9 Sep 1822 Age 17 years. Born Vergennes, VT. Died Coosada AL.

Hitchcock Henry 19 Sep 1822 son of Henry & Anne Hitchcock. Died age 9 days

Scott Fanny 5 Jan 1834 13 Jul 1834 dau of Alfred V. and Mary W. Scott. Died age 6 months and 8 days

Scott Mary Sophia 19 May 1825 11 Dec 1836 dau of Alfred V. and Mary W. Scott.

Scott Mary William Bibb 8 Mar 1809 9 Jan 1837 dau of William W. and Mary A Bibb; wife of Alfred V. Scott, Esq.

+ 3 other graves w/unreadable stones.

Historic marker near cemetery states William Wyatt Bibb was born in Amelia County VA 2 Oct 1871. Was US Congressman for Georgia from 1805-1813 and moved to AL from Elbert County GA in 1817.

Wetumpka City Cemetary

Partial listing. This cemetary is fairly old . Some of the graves are in bad shape from the passage of time and vandalism . Some are partially covered by grass .
